intro: Draba daviesiae, commonly known as the Stewart's whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, cold climates. It has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Draba daviesiae is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native habitat.
